festival.introText:
Party At The Palace is back and bigger than ever in 2023. The 3-day party will take place on Saturday 12th and Sunday 13th August in Linlithgow. The Scottish festival is situated ideally between both Glasgow and Edinburgh in Linlithgow, making it easily accessible. 

Not only does Party At The Palace have a fine lineup of rock and pop acts, it also shows off some of Scotland’s best bands. It’s set to be a lively affair.
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Party at The Palace 2023. Get Party at The Palace Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com

Bad Points

faqs.question: When is Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer: Party in the Palace takes place Saturday 12th - Sunday 13th August 2023

faqs.question: How do I get to Party at the Palace by rail?
faqs.answer:
Party at the Palace is only a short walk from Linlithgow train station. Regular services run on the Edinburgh to Glasgow mainline via Falkirk High as well as services to Dunblane via Stirling and connections north. The last services leave:

To Glasgow: 23:47

To Edinburgh: 23:27

To Stirling: 23:17

faqs.question: Disability information
faqs.answer: For disability information please email us at info@partyatthepalace.co.uk but we will update this section once we have further and more exact site details. Certainly we will look forward to welcoming one and all!

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately, we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.

faqs.question: Does Party at the Palace have onsite camping?
faqs.answer: No, Party at the Palace is a non camping festival so camping equipment is not needed. It is however close to a large choice of accommodation within 1 mile from the festival site.

faqs.question: Where is Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer:
Party at the Palace is located across the loch from Linlithgow Palace.

 

The Address

Lochside Field, Bonnytoun Farm, Linlithgow, EH49 7LP

faqs.question: Are there Carers Tickets available?
faqs.answer: They are willing to send out a free ticket for any individual who requires a carer or personal assistant to attend the Party at the Palace. An access request can be submitted via this form: https://partyatthepalace.co.uk/carers-ticket/

faqs.question: How do I get to Party at the Palace by bus?
faqs.answer: We have teamed up with concert travel specialists Happy Bus to provide coach travel. There will be coaches running from a number of locations including Glasgow, Stirling, Falkirk, Fife, Perth and Edinburgh. The Happybus prices are highly competitive with rail so if you had been planning to come by train please consider getting one of these coaches which depart from near the train stations. These buses must be booked in advance here: https://www.happybus.co.uk/party-at-the-palace-linlithgow-13th-14th-august-2022-c-957

faqs.question: Is the site suitable for wheelchairs and buggies?
faqs.answer: Party at The Palace takes place on a grass field which includes an incline. The terrain may not be suitable for all types of buggy or wheelchair but our stewards are there to help and assist where possible. Loos for people with disabilities and baby changing facilities are available on site.

faqs.question: I pay for my tickets monthly, when are the tickets sent out?
faqs.answer: Your tickets will be sent out 1 month after your last payment. eg. If your last payment was the 1st of June, your tickets will be emailed to you after the 1st of July.

faqs.question: Does Party at the Palace have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer:
No all ages are welcome at Party at the Palace - there are adult and children's tickets available.

Please note children’s ticket are as follows:

Children aged 0-5 – Free

Children aged 6 – 15 years – Child ticket applies

16 yeas and over – Adult ticket applies

faqs.question: How do I get to Party at the Palace by car?
faqs.answer:
We would encourage customers to consider the environment and choose alternative modes of getting to Party at The Palace, however if you need to bring a car, there is limited onsite parking at the event WHICH MUST BE BOOKED IN ADVANCE here: https://partyatthepalace.co.uk/product/car-park-tickets/

 

Only use the designated car park and follow directions from our event stewards. The speed limit around the parking areas is 5mph and must be observed. NO OVERNIGHT PARKING PERMITTED.

 

Disabled parking – display blue badge to be admitted to the disabled parking area.

faqs.question: Can I get a Carers Ticket for Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer:
They are willing to send out a free ticket for any individual who requires a carer or personal assistant to attend the Party at the Palace.

 

An access request can be submitted via this form: https://partyatthepalace.co.uk/carers-ticket/

faqs.question: Where can I get dropped off/picked up at Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer: If you are being dropped off by car, taxi/private hire or mini-bus, we recommend the lay by on Blackness Road. This is a drop off point only and cars must not wait or park here. The pick up point after the event is the car park to the rear of Tesco. Taxis and cars can wait here safely without blocking the roads around the event.

faqs.question: Can I give or sell my Party in the Palace tickets to someone else?
faqs.answer: Yes. But please seek advice on the various safe and ethical ways of disposing of unwanted tickets and acquiring them.

faqs.question: What should I bring to Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer:
Only bring what you REALLY need. Bringing the kitchen sink will delay your entry and everybody behind you will hate you as well! So with that in mind, here’s a list of things you can bring:

 

Please bring:

  • Your tickets – download them onto your phone or print them off.
  • I.D. – we operate a Challenge 25 policy across all bars.
  • Sensible footwear.
  • An empty water bottle for filling up at our water stations.
  • It’s an outdoor event in Scotland so pack some sun cream and a poncho.
  • Chairs and brollies are allowed in the marked zones. Please only use them with consideration to other customers.
  • Cash – we accept cards however the wi-fi can be patchy so money is a safer bet.
  • Medication – make sure you have any medication you require with you.

faqs.question: What should I not bring to Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer:
Please do not bring:

  • Food and drink. We have a large number of food outlets catering for all dietary requirements.
  • Tents or gazebos.
  • Fireworks or pyro of any kind.
  • Pets / animals
  • Professional camera/video/audio equipment with removable lenses
  • Drones
  • Glass bottles or glassware of any kind.

faqs.question: What time does Party at the Palace start?
faqs.answer: Gates open 12:30pm. First act 1.00pm. Last act on stage 8.50pm. Finishes 10:30pm. Times are approximate.

faqs.question: Are camping chairs allowed at Party at the Palace?
faqs.answer: While many find it comfortable and convenient taking in a small folding chair to sit on, they are deemed an inconvenience by others. To strike a balance, Party at the Park does allow people to bring in camping chairs however they will not be allowed to be positioned directly in front of the stage. There will be a ‘chair free zone’ in a stewarded area around 50 metres from the stage. There is a very large area beyond that in which you are welcome to ‘park’ your seating for the whole day and you can then of course move closer to the stage when you fancy getting into the thick of it and retiring back to your seats again – just like at the dancin! We would also ask you to think of the environment and take your chairs home with you.

reviewsDisplayFour.body: Amazing weekend at PATP burnt on the Saturday then drowned on Sunday with great bands and a brilliant atmosphere .

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Party At The Palace
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Perfect view of the stage in any weather and loads of food and drink choices. Who needs VIP when you can slide down the slope to the front of the stage.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Party At The Palace
reviewsDisplayFour.body: As long as it does not rain

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Party At The Palace
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Good festival  good mix of music and a relaxed atmosphere.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Party At The Palace
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Loved it especially The Charlatans and Oasis Tribute band

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Party At The Palace
Review of Party At The Palace
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
Party at the Palace was great.  Excellent venue with good music. Good crowd at least until James came on when everyone went a bit crazy.  I spent most of the day at the Purple Orange tent which was excellent to see sets I hadn't seen before.  Very chilled afternoon.  Toilet facilities were excellent also and it always needs to be said - that's a big help!  Queues for drinks were fast moving and there was overall a good atmosphere.
My only recommendation would be to have a central 'Find Me' zone as I lost my mates, mobiles died...the usual nonsense - a wee bit worse for wear - I ended up having to make my way home on my own - 30. lighter from Linlithgow to Whitburn - For that reason only, I probably wouldn't go back.  But that was bad planning on our part, nothing to with the Gig.  All a bit of an eye-opener though :) 
Overall - An excellent well planned event

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Party At The Palace
reviewsDisplayFour.body: All our company had an amazing time the only fault there wasn't enuf merchandise stalls....

news.title: Party at the Palace brings indie icons and more to Scotland
news.summary: The two day event hits Lochside Field in Linlithgow between Saturday 12 and Sunday 13th August.
